vision.notes: Present and likely important for hunting in shallow waters. No specific data on spectral sensitivity available.

olfaction.notes: Likely important for locating prey, as with most sharks. No specific data available, but inferred to be functional.

mechanoreception.notes: Lateral line system likely present and functional for detecting water movement and vibrations. Important for detecting prey and avoiding predators.

electroreception.notes: Ampullae of Lorenzini are present in sharks and used for detecting electrical fields produced by prey.

gustation.notes: Taste present, likely used to assess palatability of food items encountered on the sea floor.

audition.notes: Bamboo sharks make popping and sucking noises when feeding, and clicking noises when handled. This suggests that they can both produce and detect sounds.
